title: Death Knight (background)
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

*This article covers the obsolete player [background](/Background "Background"). For the monster, see [death knight](/Death_knight "Death knight").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The Death Knight is a fighter who aligns him or herself with the powers of death and worships Yredelemnul the Dark, who will soon grant the ability to re-animate the dead. |

**Death knights** are unholy warriors who worship [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul"), the god of Death. They are charged with opposing all things [holy](/Holy "Holy"), but in return they gain power over death and the [undead](/Undead "Undead").

Death knights start with 35 [piety](/Piety "Piety").

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Races](#Preferred_Races)
- [2 Racial Restrictions](#Racial_Restrictions)
- [3 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [4 Starting Skills and Stats](#Starting_Skills_and_Stats)
- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [6 History](#History)

## Preferred Races

[Human](/Human "Human"), [Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc"), [Troll](/Troll "Troll"), [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk"), [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur"), and [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") are the recommended races if you pick a Death Knight Background.

## Racial Restrictions

Neither [demigods](/Demigod "Demigod") nor [gargoyles](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") can be death knights, as neither can worship Yredelemnul.

## Starting Equipment

Some [species](/Species "Species") may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

- +1 [weapon of choice](/Weapon_of_choice "Weapon of choice") ([hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe"), [spear](/Spear "Spear"), [short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword"), [mace](/Mace "Mace"), or [falchion](/Falchion "Falchion"))
- +0 [leather armour](/Leather_armour "Leather armour")
- [Bread ration](/Bread_ration "Bread ration")

## Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"): 2
- Chosen Weapon's Skill: 2
- [Armour](/Armour "Armour"): 1
- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 1
- [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations"): 3

Choosing Death Knight adds 5 to your starting [Strength](/Strength "Strength"), 3 to your starting [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") and 4 to your starting [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").

## Strategy

[Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul")'s powers are primarily for the creation and enslavement of [undead](/Undead "Undead"), so this background plays a little like a [summoner](/Summoner "Summoner") with decent melee ability. Like many religious backgrounds, the role of death knight suits less magical species who need an alternate source of power. Although costly, [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul")'s Mirror Damage ability allows you to make specific dangerous encounters dramatically easier, while Life Drain is an excellent panic button when dealing with the living. Later in the game, his ability to enslave souls can make worthy slaves even of [uniques](/Unique "Unique").

## History

Death Knights were removed in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16").

Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), death knights started with 20 [gold](/Gold "Gold").

Originally, death knights had a choice between starting with a [book of Necromancy](/Book_of_Necromancy "Book of Necromancy") or worshiping Yredelemnul. In [0.7](/0.7 "0.7"), the background was removed entirely, and [priests](/Priest "Priest") were given the option to start with Yred. The ability to start with a book of Necromancy was deemed redundant to and also weaker than a plain [necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer"), and thus removed; [reavers](/Reaver "Reaver") were removed for a similar reason a version later. In [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), death knights were restored, this time only worshiping Yred (with priests correspondingly losing that option).

| [Backgrounds](/Background "Background") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| --------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Warriors                                | [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter") • [Gladiator](/Gladiator "Gladiator") • [Monk](/Monk "Monk") • [Hunter](/Hunter "Hunter") • [Brigand](/Brigand "Brigand")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Zealots                                 | [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker") • [Chaos Knight](/Chaos_Knight "Chaos Knight") • [Cinder Acolyte](/Cinder_Acolyte "Cinder Acolyte")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Warrior-mages                           | [Warper](/Warper "Warper") • [Hexslinger](/Hexslinger "Hexslinger") • [Enchanter](/Enchanter "Enchanter") • [Reaver](/Reaver "Reaver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Mages                                   | [Hedge Wizard](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard") • [Conjurer](/Conjurer "Conjurer") • [Summoner](/Summoner "Summoner") • [Necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer") • [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist") • [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist") • [Air Elementalist](/Air_Elementalist "Air Elementalist") • [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist") • [Alchemist](/Alchemist "Alchemist") |
| Adventurers                             | [Artificer](/Artificer "Artificer") • [Shapeshifter](/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter") • [Wanderer](/Wanderer "Wanderer") • [Delver](/Delver "Delver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
html:
Death Knight (background)

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

This article covers the obsolete player background. For the monster, see death knight.

The Death Knight is a fighter who aligns him or herself with the powers of death and worships Yredelemnul the Dark, who will soon grant the ability to re-animate the dead.

Death knights are unholy warriors who worship Yredelemnul, the god of Death. They are charged with opposing all things holy, but in return they gain power over death and the undead.

Death knights start with 35 piety.

Contents

  • 1 Preferred Races
  • 2 Racial Restrictions
  • 3 Starting Equipment
  • 4 Starting Skills and Stats
  • 5 Strategy
  • 6 History

Preferred Races

Human, Hill Orc, Troll, Merfolk, Minotaur, and Demonspawn are the recommended races if you pick a Death Knight Background.

Racial Restrictions

Neither demigods nor gargoyles can be death knights, as neither can worship Yredelemnul.

Starting Equipment

Some species may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

  • +1 weapon of choice (hand axe, spear, short sword, mace, or falchion)
  • +0 leather armour
  • Bread ration

Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' aptitudes.

  • Fighting: 2
  • Chosen Weapon's Skill: 2
  • Armour: 1
  • Dodging: 1
  • Invocations: 3

Choosing Death Knight adds 5 to your starting Strength, 3 to your starting Intelligence and 4 to your starting Dexterity.

Strategy

Yredelemnul's powers are primarily for the creation and enslavement of undead, so this background plays a little like a summoner with decent melee ability. Like many religious backgrounds, the role of death knight suits less magical species who need an alternate source of power. Although costly, Yredelemnul's Mirror Damage ability allows you to make specific dangerous encounters dramatically easier, while Life Drain is an excellent panic button when dealing with the living. Later in the game, his ability to enslave souls can make worthy slaves even of uniques.

History

Death Knights were removed in 0.16.

Prior to 0.14, death knights started with 20 gold.

Originally, death knights had a choice between starting with a book of Necromancy or worshiping Yredelemnul. In 0.7, the background was removed entirely, and priests were given the option to start with Yred. The ability to start with a book of Necromancy was deemed redundant to and also weaker than a plain necromancer, and thus removed; reavers were removed for a similar reason a version later. In 0.8, death knights were restored, this time only worshiping Yred (with priests correspondingly losing that option).

Backgrounds
Warriors Fighter • Gladiator • Monk • Hunter • Brigand
Zealots Berserker • Chaos Knight • Cinder Acolyte
Warrior-mages Warper • Hexslinger • Enchanter • Reaver
Mages Hedge Wizard • Conjurer • Summoner • Necromancer • Fire Elementalist • Ice Elementalist • Air Elementalist • Earth Elementalist • Alchemist
Adventurers Artificer • Shapeshifter • Wanderer • Delver

{{flavour|The Death Knight is a fighter who aligns him or herself with the powers of death and worships Yredelemnul the Dark, who will soon grant the ability to re-animate the dead.}}
'''Death knights''' are unholy warriors who worship [[Yredelemnul]], the god of Death. They are charged with opposing all things [[holy]], but in return they gain power over death and the [[undead]].

Death knights start with 35 [[piety]].

==Preferred Races==

[[Human]], [[Hill Orc]], [[Troll]], [[Merfolk]], [[Minotaur]], and [[Demonspawn]] are the recommended races if you pick a Death Knight Background.

==Racial Restrictions==
Neither [[demigod]]s nor [[gargoyle]]s can be death knights, as neither can worship Yredelemnul.

==Starting Equipment==
Some [[species]] may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.
*+1 [[weapon of choice]] ([[hand axe]], [[spear]], [[short sword]], [[mace]], or [[falchion]])
*+0 [[leather armour]]
*[[Bread ration]]

==Starting Skills and Stats==
These are adjusted by your species' [[aptitude]]s.
*[[Fighting]]: 2
*Chosen Weapon's Skill: 2
*[[Armour]]: 1
*[[Dodging]]: 1
*[[Invocations]]: 3

Choosing Death Knight adds 5 to your starting [[Strength]], 3 to your starting [[Intelligence]] and 4 to your starting [[Dexterity]].

==Strategy==
[[Yredelemnul]]'s powers are primarily for the creation and enslavement of [[undead]], so this background plays a little like a [[summoner]] with decent melee ability. Like many religious backgrounds, the role of death knight suits less magical species who need an alternate source of power. Although costly, [[Yredelemnul]]'s Mirror Damage ability allows you to make specific dangerous encounters dramatically easier, while Life Drain is an excellent panic button when dealing with the living. Later in the game, his ability to enslave souls can make worthy slaves even of [[unique]]s.

==History==
Death Knights were removed in [[0.16]].

Prior to [[0.14]], death knights started with 20 [[gold]].

Originally, death knights had a choice between starting with a [[book of Necromancy]] or worshiping Yredelemnul. In [[0.7]], the background was removed entirely, and [[priest]]s were given the option to start with Yred. The ability to start with a book of Necromancy was deemed redundant to and also weaker than a plain [[necromancer]], and thus removed; [[reaver]]s were removed for a similar reason a version later. In [[0.8]], death knights were restored, this time only worshiping Yred (with priests correspondingly losing that option).
